WorkItem.ClosedComment: A fix has been checked in and will be visible in an upcoming release.
WorkItem.Description:
I have my TS project on Mac and access the project through Win 7 on VMWare Fusion 5. The path to my project is:

"//vmware-host/Shared Folders/.../my-ts-project

let's say in the project I have a.ts and b.ts in the same directory.

Now if in file a.ts I use: import a=module("b"); typescript's intellisense does not find b.ts and its contents.

If I copy the same project on my Windows desktop directory, the same things works just fine.

Note: this problem does not occur for references, i.e., ///<reference path="b.ts" /> would work just fine.
WorkItem.Summary: import module does not recognize path on a networked/vmware location

Comments.Message:
VMWare mounts my Mac's home directory to Z:.
If I access to and open my project's solution file from inside VS through Z:, it works fine!
